parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> ofp

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.00

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> System

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Returns the value of "3D Performance" in OFP Preferences (flashpoint.cfg). This can be used to estimate the computer performance to adapt CPU and GPU demanding settings like view distance dynamically in missions.

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> [[Number]] <ext><name>nowiki</name><attr/><inner>=</inner><close></nowiki></close></ext> '''benchmark'''

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Number]]
		  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <ext><name>pre</name><attr/><inner>? (benchmark>2000) : setViewDistance 2000</inner><close></pre></close></ext>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[viewDistance]], [[setDetailMapBlendPars]], [[setTerrainGrid]], [[getObjectViewDistance]], [[setObjectViewDistance]]
</value></part></template>

<dl class="command_description">
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment>
<dd class="notedate">Posted on 14 March 2014</dd>
<dt class="note>'''[[User:Killzone_Kid|Killzone_Kid]]'''
<dd class="note">
The command is obsolete, it was used in OFP to measure PC performance. In A3 it returns 2000.


<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl>
